sect1.title: aRts-&arts-version;

para.screen: Estimated build disk space: 35 MB Estimated installed space: 5.7 MB Package size: &arts-size; Estimated build time: 11 min (667 MHz)

sect1.para: The Analog Realtime Synthesizer (aRts) provides sound support for KDE. It provides necessary libraries for kdelibs. It will use the following optional packages, if installed: , , , and .

note.para: Another configure option is --enable-final. This option can speed up the build process, but requires a lot of memory. If you have less than 256MB of RAM, this option will cause swapping and significantly slow compilation. This option applies to all the kde packages.

sect2.title: aRts Installation Commmand explanations
sect2.para: --prefix=&kde-dir;: This option tells the process to install the package in &kde-dir;.

warning.para: objprelink has been known to cause problems on some systems. If it does not work on your system you will have to rebuild kde without it.

sect2.para: --enable-objprelink: This option enables the linking process to optimize executable loading times by prelinking many internal references.
--disable-debug: This option causes the system to be compiled without debugging code.
--disable-dependency-tracking: This option speeds up one time builds.

ln -s &kde-dir; /opt/kde: This command creates a link for access to KDE. If a newer version of KDE is released, the new system can be built by changing the --prefix location and then set up by just changing the link.

sect2.title: Configuring aRts
sect2.para:
The library directory /opt/kde/lib should appear in /etc/ld.so.conf so that ldd can find the shared libraries. The following command will add it if it is missing: cat >> /etc/ld.so.conf << "EOF" # Begin kde addition to /etc/ld.so.conf
/opt/kde/lib
# End kde addition EOF ldconfig
